Description: Convex fragment from the body of a vessel: in opaque white glass. The body is decorated with wide, parallel threads running at a slight diagonal in alternating dark blue and turquoise-blue; probably to be reconstructed as belonging to a complex and large-scale chevron pattern. The thick walls taper towards the upper undecorated body. Certainly from a larger than average vessel. Glossy surface. Tan core.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.32, p.33)
